Plays > The Summer Festival at Naniwa

– Click image to view.

The Summer Festival at Naniwa

(夏祭浪花鑑) (Natsumatsuri Naniwa kagami)

Written By: Namiki Senryū (See also Namiki Namiki Sōsuke) (並木千柳) , Miyoshi Shōraku (三好松洛) , Takeda Koizumo (竹田小出雲)

First Staged: 1745

Reference: Keene, Donald, Bunraku: The Art of the Japanese Puppet Theatre (Tokyo: Kodansha International, 1973); Kokuritsu Gekijō jōen shiryōshū, edited by Kokuritsu Gekijō Geinō Chōsashitsu, vol. 177, May 1980; Hironaga, Shūzaburō, The Bunraku Handbook (Tokyo: Maison des Arts, 1976); July 1985 Program

Kashira:

Wakaotoko (若男)

Hagataki (端敵)

Hayaku (端役)

Bunshichi (文七)

Musume (娘)

Kenbishi (検非違使)

Masamune (正宗)

Fukeoyama (老女形)

Toraō (虎王)

Otoko koyaku (男子役)

Tsurifune (釣船)

Genta (源太)

Tedai (手代)

Darasuke (陀羅助)

Sadanoshin (定之進)

Yokanbei (与勘平)

Sanmaime (三枚目)

Performances:

July 1971: The Summer Festival at Naniwa

May 1976: The Summer Festival at Naniwa

July 1978: The Summer Festival at Naniwa

May 1980: The Summer Festival at Naniwa

July 1982: The Summer Festival at Naniwa

July 1985: The Summer Festival at Naniwa

July 1987: The Summer Festival at Naniwa

September 1987: The Summer Festival at Naniwa

August 1993: The Summer Festival at Naniwa

September 1993: The Summer Festival at Naniwa

July/August 2001: The Summer Festival at Naniwa

Scenes:

The Three Blind Masseurs (三人座頭)

The Temporary Mansion at Tsurugaoka (鶴が岡仮屋)

Kōjō [announcement/special performance] (口上)

The Dry Riverbed of Shijo (四条河原)

The Monkey Dance (堀川猿廻し)

The Yoshida Shrine (吉田社頭)

Characters:

Sabu (釣船三婦)

Ichimatsu (伜市松)

Okaji (団七女房お梶)

Koppa-no-gon (こっぱの権)

Namako-no-hachi (なまこの八 (なまの八))

Isonojo (玉島磯之丞 (清七実は磯之丞))

Danshichi (団七九郎兵衛)

Government official (役人)

Kotoura (傾城琴浦)

Sagaemon (大鳥佐賀右衛門)

Tokubei (一寸徳兵衛)

Onaka (娘お中)

Giheiji (三河屋義平次)

Dempachi (番頭伝八)

Yaichi (仲買弥市)

Magoemon (道具屋孫右衛門)

Otsugi (三婦女房おつぎ)

Otatsu (徳兵衛女房お辰)

Sazen (代官左膳)

Constables (捕手)

Palanquin bearer (駕屋)

Youngsters (若中)
